title: So I have to ship my weight scale...
body:
... and as with all shipments, I have to weigh it...

I leave you, the omnipotent League community-that-has-nothing-to-do-with-shipping-weight-scales to solve one of the greatest paradoxes the universe has ever known, for me.

Although I'll leave you with a few options to delve into.

RE Option 4: If you're in zero gravity, nothing you put on the scale has weight, so the only weight the scale could read, is itself. "But then the scale would be weightless" you say? Au contraire! Weighing the scale with itself is parodoxically impossible. Therefore it has no self-weighed weight to begin with. Therefore, there's no weighable weight that can be taken away by zero-gravity. Since zero-gravity can't take away the weight, the weight remains in zero-gravity. -Q.E.WUT. :D

replies.body: Build one of those old fashioned scales with a rock and a piece of 2x4 or plywood. stack enough stuff on the other side to counter balance the scale. then box up and weigh the assortment of other odds and ends. Then once you have finnished that you can then safely box up your scale with the weight so you can ship it.
Doesn't count. Wouldn't be weighing the scale with itself. Not half as cool.
